item.title: LenguaPlus
item.desc: A plugin for CodeIgniter that manages translations of system copy and user-generated content. It was built within Track Authority, this site, and extended for Interactive's Dashboard project in order to version control text changes by authorized user/authors
item.technotes: Includes 8 configuration for tracking and translating system text and user-generated-content by environment and language

item.title: LealtadCard
item.devtools: Native Android SDK,Java,Facebook SDK,Chord Framework,All-Share Framework
item.desc: A tool for independent retailers to publish and track promotions, along with their returned value and cost. For consumers, LealtadCard provides a way to search nearby promotions and publish their own controlled requests for good deals.
item.technotes: The promotions could be sent via SMS or Galaxy's Chord Framework. The interface and CMS is still in development.
item.pitch: A tool for independent retailers to publish and track promotions, along with their ROI (returned-on-investment). For consumers, LealtadCard provides a way to search nearby promotions and publish their own controlled requests for good deals.
item.bizmodel:
• $1 / mo fee to store owners for upgraded features in loyalty programs and customer details
  • Sell Direct Advertising to consumers in an open market of 1-day-only promotions.
  • Services for designing / developing engaging mobile ads apps.
  • Build interactive and engaging maps for malls
item.futuredate:
• 6 months: promotions
  • 1 year: in malls without maps
  • 1.5 years: without maps and directory listings

item.title: Track Authority
item.desc: A music-gaming application that rewards high rated users with free music, gift certificates, concert tickets and cash.
item.technotes:
The website runs in a LAMP environment, and is highly optimized by several Bash scripts
  • One is run from a CRON to use ImageMagick for cropping and resizing images based on automated cue table maintained when a size or shape is requested that has not yet been cut.
  • Another is for re-indexing the music catalogue - of 20,000 songs and growing. It extends a tool called Beets to correct mp3 meta-data, download artwork and lyrics, and determine sound-wave averages such as BPM (beats-per-minute) and Replay Gain (used to determine average encoded decibel volume of the sound wave).
  • The backend system also includes an asynchronous email service which I linked seamlessly to the front-end webpage templates with a CSS inliner script.
  • The site scales very well to all screen widths above 320 pixels wide, but I am well underway with a native Android version of the player with 0-100 scale music ratings to refine the rotation of songs.
  • It also includes a CodeIgniter plugin that manages translations of system copy and user-generated content, with version controlling text changes by authorized user/authors.
item.pitch: A music-gaming application for music lovers to play, exchange, and reward musical taste. Highly rated users are rewarded with free music, gift certificates, concert tickets and cash from sponsors and partners
item.bizmodel:
• Concert ticket re-sales
  • $1 - $10 subscriptions to ad-free listening and extra playlist features
  • Concert ticket promtions, advertising and sales
item.marketresearch:
• Concert Ticket sold 52 million (2011) - source
  • Concert Ticket Revenue 3.1 Billion USD (2011) - source
  • Pollstar lists 10,859 touring artists, 71,823 Events - source
  • musicbrainz.org/statistics
  • ASCAP: 435,000 composters, songwriters, music publishers
  • BMI: 500,000 composters, songwriters, music publishers
item.expenses:
• 15% design
  • 70% development
  • 10% sales
  • 5% accounting
  • 5% legal
item.futuredate: • 6 months: mobile app & site complete

item.title: ID Dashboard
item.team: Design:E.A.Taylor;Front-End:E.A.Taylor;Back-End:E.A.Taylor;Business Development:Juan Ruiz,Claudia Huertas;Project Management:Alejandra Farfan,David Duran;QA:John Parra
item.desc: The tool automates monthly reports due clients, by aggregating data from all active marketing channels or installed tracking tools, such as Twitter, Facebook Insights, Google Anayltics and, Youtube.
item.technotes: Over 45 Google Visualization Graphs can be created in less than 10 seconds. By entering just a few project goals in the form of KPIs (Key Performance Indicators), graphs are automatically colorized in to indicate how they are performing. Project & account managers can also using a simple CMS built within the reports to comment on specific metrics, add headers, group graphics, change sizes and drill on the data through AJAX connections to all the original API services. The permissions matrix is controlled per client, brand, and project with 6 levels of access, including publishing public reports with encrypted URLs. The original codebase was writen in the Laraval PHP Framework which somewhat resembles Ruby. I have since completely replaced that codebase with CodeIgniter.

item.title: Sedal Rizos
item.team: Design:Zandro Gil;Front-End:E.A.Taylor,Fabian Mariño;Back-End:E.A.Taylor;Project Management:Natalia Uribe;QA:Jimmy Rodriguez
item.desc: A curly-hair competition for a $250 shopping spree
item.technotes: Another quick campaign application to generate FanPage likes. In order to compete users were required to like Sedal's FanPage, complete regisration, and upload videos, images, or a tip on maintaining their curly hair (ideally using Sedal products;). Voting was validated by IP, user agent, and session, while video uploads were POST'd directly to a public YouTube channel using their PHP SDK. The project extended ID's fork of the Slim PHP Framework. I personally found more hurdles than helpers in the tightly namespaced codebase and it's odd use of closures for routing/controllers.

item.title: Oreo Navidad
item.team: Design:Cristopher Allen Lara;Front-End:E.A.Taylor;Back-End:E.A.Taylor;Project Management:Oscar Gil;Account Manager:Sharon Lewis;QA:Jimmy Rodriguez,John Parra
item.desc: IDinteractive builds marketing platforms for a long list of great clients with creative projects and campaigns. One of the most fun I built in a quick 4 weeks was Oreo Navidad. The campaign was based on 20 million codes printed on Oreo packages throughout Colombia. There were 5 types of prizes to win in varying amounts with a total of 285 to give. No one code could be considered a winner in advance, and the prizes should be distributed evenly throughout the ~60 day campaign. I wrote the probability to be related to the average number of people playing daily and distributed all prizes - by number and type – evenly until the last day.
item.technotes: A search against the 20 million codes took .00020 seconds, and the site supported business rules such as Catpcha when a user searched more than 12 times in a day. I also included several backend tracking tools and a automated QA tester to simulate varying degrees of traffic, code searches, and minimum probabilities.

item.title: Collectiv LLC
item.team: Design:Jamie Williams,E.A.Taylor;Front-End:Jamie Williams,E.A.Taylor;Back-End:Jamie Williams;Project Management:Eli Taylor,Drew Williams,Tommy Goodwin
item.desc:
• The Collectiv was born in the summer of 2001 in Oakland, CA. Our organization was founded by A. Williams, aka Sokrates, with a mission to "empower the Hip Hop community through education and entrepreneurship." We pursue this mission by sponsoring a diverse range of programs with distinct yet cooperative goals. We work with young entrepreneurs, activists and artists to design financially viable programs that will provide new opportunities for empowerment. We seek to create the perfect environment for turning an idea into impact.
  • The Collectiv currently sponsors three programs, Collectiv Records, Collectiv Arts & Entertainment and Collectiv Foundation. Each of these programs occupies a distinct niche within the Hip Hop community.

item.title: Healthline Navigator
item.desc: A Contextual Enrichment Tool Of Rich-Media Health Information and Ads.
item.technotes:
• Navigator is a cross-domain script tag used to inject contextual ads and content onto any web page from a single line of JavaScript.
  • The system supports up to 60 requests per second including tracking pixels and over 50,000 SQL inserts batched daily through an asynchronous SQL loader. (Clients included healthline.com, sharecare.com, health.yahoo.net, drugs.com and others)
  • Units can be injected on-load and by user-engagement, directly on the page, or by hyper-linking keywords in the page source. Keywords can be pre-selected during the crawling process or via a client-side DOM scanner searching common semantics and other ad tags running simultaneously. This allows well targeted advertising services without a backend processor for contextualization
  • It can automatically detect appropriate ad placement via another DOM scanner that measures element's amount of text, dimensions, DOM structure and tag types. It also can be more tightly controlled via Dashboard described below.
  • Injected content - where hyper-links remain on the host website – can be placed to provide additional navigation tools for the user. However this requires pre-indexing the client's entire site. This process is targeted, cued and controlled by Navigator and its Dashboard, described below.

item.title: Healthline Dashboard
item.desc: Dashboard is an all-in-one Content-Management-System, Reporting, and Ad Configuration tool. It controls where, when and why to inject ads or content in webpages. It also allows reviewing Navigator, healthSTAT, and internal crawler's performance across various installations.
item.technotes:
• Dashboard aids in backend debugging of the Healthline Taxonomy and search decisions. It also provides the crawler additional controls for prioritizing areas of the page to parse, skip, and flag for changes or inter-linking .
  • Through Dashboard you can rebuild any webpage within a proxy environment on Healthline servers in order to install, test, and demonstrate Navigation functionality on any URL

item.title: Healthline computeQA
item.desc: Automated Quality Assurance & Monitoring Through Interactive, Intelligent Browser-Based Crawling.
item.technotes:
• A Google Chrome Extension and browser-based Crawler to automate QA of both source code, flash ads, any JavaScript installation.
  • Builds automated reports on how pages are categorized by many different engines and APIs, while tracking the web of links between each page. Everything is stored in SQLite LocalStorage via Lawnchair. Ex. healthline.com/corporate/navigator/stage/crawler.html?domain=sharecare or ?domain=healthline (both take a while to load all 30K rows)
  • Takes .jpg screenshots of every page crawled. It can also first render watermarks or outline all areas of the page by targeting categories for easier review & debugging.

item.title: Studio En Vivo
item.desc: An mobile beat machine to create and share music with friends
item.technotes: The music is shared a runtime using Galaxy's All-Share and Chord Framework
item.pitch: A mobile beat machine to create and share music with friends. I brought this idea up to the group when we talked about doing that Samsung challenge. I've started with wireframes, but only have basic code done to handle the initial connection via the Chord Framework.
item.bizmodel:
• $1 download ad-free version
  • $5 download ad-free with offline access and cloud storage
item.futuredate: • 6 months: mobile app site complete

item.title: Known Your Numbers
item.desc: A set of 30 health assessment and preparation tools developed for OptumHealth, a division of UnitedHealth Group
item.technotes: The business requirements insisted that the tool be distributable as a single self-contained file which could be easily reskinned for other brands. It was not clear if their target device's would run Java (Applets), but certain they had browsers with Flash, so used Flex and AS3.

item.title: Munchie Madness
item.technotes: These two links are just a few of the very interactive microsites / applications I built for Healthline's editorial team or sponsoring partners.

item.title: Elite Wedding Locations
item.desc: A reporting system for advertisers to view site traffic, user inquiries on their properties, and return-on-investment figures.
item.technotes: This system included 3 levels of access with top level administrators being able to change cost values per account or property, receive notifications upon account logins, and scheduling custom reports to be email at any frequency or timespan, to anyone. The system provides complete drilling capabilities on any data set for any time frame; and populates both Flex graphs and DHTML tables and charts with a single click.

item.title: Black Panther Party
item.desc: Design & developed a unique interface for navigating articles, essays, events, and new program initiatives.
item.technotes: Implemented the Google Language API (php) to translate entire site and individual articles to nearly any language using an asynchronous AJAX cue-engine to control http request priorities, frequency and timeouts. Extended open source CMS OpenCart with configuration options to map and re-stylize all products and profiles

item.title: ChartMedica
item.desc: Features included an advanced pdf viewing tool, autocompletes searching over 600K records, and automated faxing via MyFax API.
item.technotes: Developed Flex-based interface for a patient's medical records system. Extended the server-side services to generate dynamic PDF (fpdf) of records and record requests. PDFs were then automatically faxed to physician offices when 5 available incoming fax lines to parse and import records (using myFax.com API). The application also included other libraries and components such as e-signing with Flex and hospital searches by location and specialty.

item.title: The Means
item.desc:
A vision from Biko Eisen-Martin for his students at Berkeley High School to create a tool for teachers and students to collaborate and compete in the writing process. Modeled after a traditional newsroom, students and teachers would be able to develop assignements, work on multiple versions of a story, share ideas within the class, and more. We built a prototype site that supported a semester of great essays still worth reading, but the project lost momentum as we both moved cities.

This project's greatest potential was in a version-controller for teachers to review, grade and provide feedback on student's essays, while peer reviews drove friendly competition between writer and school rankings.

If you are in Education, and feel this or something similiar could help your classroom and your school district, email me. I'd love bring this back to life own our spare time.
item.technotes: UI Tools include tinyMCE text editor, advance sourcing maps, and multi-category search options
item.pitch: A tool for teachers and students to collaborate and compete in the writing process. Modeled after a traditional newsroom, students and teachers would be able to develop assignments, work on multiple versions of a story, share ideas within the class, and more.
item.bizmodel:
• License to private schools & learning institutions
  • Donate to the public school system, gain publicity and intimite access to the youth market, along with tax deducations from donation.
item.marketresearch:
• SchoolNewsPaperOnline.com/pricing - $600 - $3,900 USD / year
  • http://www.yourstudentnews.com/article.php?id=8 - $25 - $400 USD / year
  • iHigh.com - advertising model
item.futuredate:
• 6 months: beta
  • 1 year: in schools

item.title: MyCubi.com
item.team: Front-End:E.A.Taylor,Anatoliy Yastreb;Back-End:E.A.Taylor,Anatoliy Yastreb;Product Development:Danielle McCormick,Maeve Hackett,Will McCormick,Michael D Montoya,Colm Walsh
item.desc: A social networking tool for connecting sellers, buyers, and services
item.technotes:
• Wrote advanced search logic for finding and filtering results by type, distance, price, date, time and other criteria.
  • Plotted all search results on a Google mapping application - by distance using the Haversine formula - with custom markers for Cubi type. Upon clicking markers expanded with tabbed windows to provide additional StreetViews, 'cubi' details, and directions (using Google maps v2 api).
  • Built Facebook application (using FBConnect) to post on user walls and send messages to friend's inboxes.
  • Integrated and upgraded social networking 'inviter' script to share/publish user profiles and details across a dozen email clients and two dozen social networks.

item.title: Planet Maple
item.technotes: Design & developed e-commerce platform based on CMS OpenCart with custom modules for resident skater / surfer profiles and FBConnect (depreciated)

item.title: BCBGMaxAzriaGroup
item.team: Design:Natasha Li;Front-End:E.A.Taylor,Robert Baindourve;Back-End:Edwin Ado,Ray;Artistic Direction:Edwin Roses
item.desc: A major overhaul of the corporate branding home
item.technotes:
• Created Fall 2008 BCBGMaxAzriaGroup company site and flash catalogue with another team member
  • Built BCBG.tv to archive all video content with search and sorting capabilities. Delivered thumbnail and text descriptions of every video with content pulled from static XML, Flash Media Server, and mySQL/PHP
  • Created Tell-A-Friend applications for users to email their friends products and links directly from our site
  • Added client side features for saving settings and style preferences via Local Shared Objects (flash cookies)

item.desc: The highest priced brand from the BCBGMaxAzriaGroup

item.title: Building Safety Solutions
item.desc: Commercial software providing interactive emergency evacuation training for skyscrapers and public buildings throughout the US. Advanced UI tools include detail floor maps of emergency equipment and exit routes with controls for sorting and searching
item.technotes:
• Integrated Building-Safety-Solution's (www.bssnet.com) emergency evacuation training program with Ameriprise Financial's Learning-Management-System (LMS). Used Flash's External Interface to join the interface and Scorm 1.2 LMS
  • Wrote a JSFL script to export, convert and organize named layers directly from Illustrator CS3 into a single Flash movie clip. A naming convention for each layer in Illustrator specified how movie clips were named and embedded within each other. This provided the core content for a standalone Flash product which I built to allow safety professionals and engineers to zoom and locate safety equipment, stairwells, sprinklers and more, on every floor, throughout multiple skyscrapers.

item.title: The A&E Advisor
item.desc: Before E-books, this has been a dream to produce a fully interactive textbook for the Legal and Strategical Aspects of the Music Recording Industry
item.technotes: Through predictive questioning, the tool was meant to create completely customized contracts from a intelligent questionnaire about the parties involved, their interests, and needs. Provides bi-partisian advice from attorneys, artists, and industry professionals
item.pitch:
An e-Textbook for the Legal and Strategical Aspects of the Music Recording Industry.

The tool would guide and prepare Artists, Concert Promoters, Event Venues, and Talent Managers through fair and prepared negotiations for a wide variety of agreements.

The snapshots of the Booking Wizard contract template was early versions of text advice from Che Hashim, JD. The interactive questionarre would include video, podcasts, and experienced advice from prominent attorneys, and the direct experiences of Artists, managers, and other industry professionals.
item.bizmodel:
• $50 textbook sold through music and law institutions and universities
  • $10 - $50 online subscriptions.
item.marketresearch:
• Pollstar lists 10,859 touring artists, 71,823 Events - source
  • 815,000 artists self-registered on musicbrainz.org
  • ASCAP: 435,000 composters, songwriters, music publishers - source
  • BMI: 500,000 composters, songwriters, music publishers - source
item.expenses:
• 10% design
  • 40% development
  • 20% legal
  • 20% sales
  • 10% interviews / endorsements
item.futuredate:
• 1 year: mobile & site: 5 interactive, online contracts templates
  • 1.5 years: contract wizard engine complete
  • 2 years: selling in schools
item.competition:

  • Nolo Press Intellectual Property Books $20 - $200.00 USD
  • Amazon's most popular contract bookss - $20 - $200 USD
  • Pollstar subscriptions - $400 - $800 USD
  • LegalZoom Band Partnership Agreement - $29.99 USD

item.title: Good Life With Gabby
item.desc: A fun, educational site for kids and parents to learn about, and find recipes on healthy lifestyles and nutrition. Includes tooling book, jquery shopping page, recipes table, videos, and translation of virtually everything into 12 languages at runtime via google's language API.
item.technotes: Designed and developed all animation and interactivity for a kids' website on healthy eating habits and recipes (AS2/XML/PHP: www.goodlifewithgabby.com / flash.goodlifewithgabby.com). Applications included coloring book, recipes sorter, dynamic video player, and language translator via Google Language API
